c:atomType.name: AxisDomainAlign
c:atomType.c:documentation:
The domain alignment possible values.
The domain alignment is used to decide which values to keep in the domain.
For options like fixedLength (see and ) and ratio (see ), when specified with domainAlign , the domain is altered so that a given domain length is kept (domain length is either fixedLength or derived from ratio . When altering the domain, some values will be kept and others may be lost. The domain alignment specifies which values are kept.
This only applies when the domain has some order among its elements, and, consequently, some minimum and maximum values.

c:atom.name: Min
c:atom.c:documentation: The minimum value is kept in the domain and the maximum may be lost.

c:atom.name: Max
c:atom.c:documentation: The maximum value is kept in the domain and the minimum may be lost.

c:atom.name: Center
c:atom.c:documentation:
Both minimum and maximum may be lost. However, the center is kept:
center = (maximum - minimum)/2.
